children.subject:
Putting this down here bc I don't know the enrollment answer but I want to caution you to plan carefully if you do decide to take 70+61c together. If you take them at the same time, make sure your other class(es) are the easiest thing you can take, because 70+61c will take up 85% of your time. 

For reference, I took 61C + 70 together this semester with NutrSci10 and Stat133 (two very easy classes), and it was  difficult balancing the workload, especially when this semester 70+61c midterms were either the same day or one day after each other, I had a third midterm the day after, and either a 61C project or 70 hw due at the end of the week. 

If you do decide to take both (it was convenient for me to take them in spring and get them over with), stay on top of the assignments - start projects early (especially project 3), and don't worry as much about assignments when midterms come around - make sure to take some practice tests (my mistake I didn't do enough) instead.

history.content: I'm considering taking CS61C in the fall. I'm in L&S still undeclared, so I'll be taking it concurrently with CS 70 so I am a little worried about the workload. Is  61C one of the CS classes that anyone can enroll in even if it becomes "full" on calcentral? I'm still debating whether or not to take it but I don't know if it's worth putting myself on the waitlist by swapping with another class or if I should just wait.
history.subject: CS 61C enrollment seats?
